channel.title: Setting images for the backround of a client
channel.description:
In this simple tutorial, I will explaining to you how to set and cut an image to be the background of your client.
[b]Purpose:[/b] To set and cut an image to be the background of your client
[b]Difficulty:[/b] 2/10
[b]Classes Modified:[/b] Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub.java, Microsoft Paint
[b]Assumed Knowledge:[/b] How to click with a mouse, type with a keyboard
<---<-<-<>->->---> [b][u]Chapters[/u][/b] [b]Chapter #1:[/b] Sizing the image [b]Chapter #2:[/b] Saving the image with the client <---<-<-<>->->--->
~~~[b]Chapter #1:[/b] Sizing the image~~~
[u][b]Step #1[/b][/u] First, you need to find an image that you wish to use for the background. Use google if you need too.
[u][b]Step #2[/b][/u] Secondly, you need to open up Microsoft paint and paste the image there. Please note that the size should be larger than 766 x 503 or exactly that.
[IMG]http://i184.photobucket.com/albums/x231/Rylee1010/img1.jpg[/img]
[u][b]Step #3[/b][/u] Thirdly, you must size the image properly to make it work with the client. To do this, go to "Image" at the top of Paint. From there click "Attributes". A screen will come up like this:
[IMG]http://i184.photobucket.com/albums/x231/Rylee1010/img2-1.jpg[/img]
Set the Width to 766 and the Height to 503.
[u][b]Step #4[/b][/u] Now, you need to select the "Select tool". This is the tool at the top-right that looks like a dotted rectangle. Go to the very bottem of your image and click and hold. Watch the numbers on the side increase. Get the numbers to "383 x 503".
[IMG]http://i184.photobucket.com/albums/x231/Rylee1010/img3.jpg[/img]
[u][b]Step #5[/b][/u] While still selected, right click and click "Flip/rotate". Click ok. You will see your image flip. Before you do this, you can add any text on the image.
[IMG]http://i184.photobucket.com/albums/x231/Rylee1010/img4.jpg[/img]
[u][b]Step #6[/b][/u] Now, click "File" and "Save as". Save it as any image. [b]Do not forget to save it as .jpg format otherwise the client can not read it.
~~~[b]Chapter #2:[/b] Saving the image with the client~~~
[u][b]Step #1[/b][/u] Open up your client folder.
[u][b]Step #2[/b][/u] Open up: Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java . Search for: [code] Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage [/code]
Beside it, you will see something like this: [code] ("imagenamehere.jpg"); [/code]
Change the "imagenamehere" to what you saved your background image as.
[u][b]Step #3[/b][/u] Save and close it. Now, compile your client and run it. All should work!
[b]Credits: Tico135[/b]

item.title: Setting images for the backround of a client
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Have you seen your signature recently? If you tried compiling that it would just FAIL, because:

  1. You haven’t declared the boolean addItem(int ID, int amount)
  2. You haven’t declared the boolean sendMessage(String s)
  3. You haven’t declared the int playerRights

And you tell Tico135 his TUT is basic knowledge ?!

Read full topic

item.title: Setting images for the backround of a client
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

eczema3:

Well, is there a way to set the client so you dont need a background image in the client ?

Paint it black. And no, you need one otherwise the client will give a load error.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @dat_batman dat batman
item.description:
@dat_batman wrote:

[quote=“i_own_pking, post:25, topic:174026”][quote author=crank batman link=topic=234384.msg2186533#msg2186533 date=1208210720]
ty tico u my fav mod and nice tut i apreciate this tut rly helped me out
[/quote]

His not a mod, his a veteran.

Tico:

Do not forget to save it as .jpg format otherwise the client can not read it.

Yes it can, i use a png file background… Also, i used my own file, just renamed before, it was .zb so it would just appear as a file and they wouldn’t know how to edit it :P[/quote]
By the pokemon thing it says moparscape moderator

item.dc:creator: @i_own_pking i_own_pking
item.description:
@i_own_pking wrote:

His not a mod, his a veteran.

[b]Do not forget to save it as .jpg format otherwise the client can not read it.[/b]

Yes it can, i use a png file background… Also, i used my own file, just renamed before, it was .zb so it would just appear as a file and they wouldn’t know how to edit it

item.title: Setting images for the backround of a client
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

hellsing604:

what do i do when i find this in client Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(System.getProperty(“user.dir”) + ("\BIN\DATA\logo.gif")); how do i change the picutre??

When you find this:

            Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage

You will see this beside it:

("imagenamehere.jpg");

Change the “imagenamehere” to the name of the picture you want, but please note there must be a copy of that image inside your client folder.

Read full topic
